channel.title: Hazel's Life Adventure
channel.description: Recent content on Hazel's Life Adventure

item.title: Build a Portfolio using Hugo and github
item.description: This is not my first time try to build my own website, but finally make it on-line. In the end of last semester, I actually finish my own ePortfolio through WordPress. It was on-line through school’s WordPress account. I was also quite satisfied of my hard work. However, everything got deleted accidentally by a school technician. Eventhough I felt upset and kind of mad. Well, how can I say. That’s it!

item.title: About Me
item.description: Hi there, my name is Hazel. A student software/web developer. Here is my experience 2022 Mar - Now Crew Member McDonald's Canada 2021 Sep - Now Student of Information Computer System Technology Camosun College, Victoria, BC, Canada 2021 Feb - 2021 Jul Self-learner Alpha Camp - Full-Stack web development online bootcamp at Taiwan 2019 Aug - 2021 Feb Research Assistant Taipei Medical University, Taipei, Taiwan 2016 Sep - 2019 Jan Master of Science in Sports Medicine Kaohsiung Medical University, Kaohsiung, Taiwan 2018 Apr - 2018 Aug Exchange Student - Junior Year Overseas Program Yokohama National University, Kanagawa, Japan 2012 Sep - 2016 Jun Bachelor of Science in Sports Medicine Kaohsiung Medical University, Kaohsiung, Taiwan And More Currently, I am an Information Technology student studying at Camosun College located in Victoria, BC, Canada.

item.title: Ringfit Fanpage
item.description: Source Code at Github This small responsive page only use HTML and CSS. I made it for ICS118 mid-term project, but it was also my first time using video tag in HTML. I learned how to do media query and z-index better through making this webpage. It was a good practice at that time. The video used in the project come from Offical Nintendo Youtube Channel Click me or the image below to see real DEMO

item.title: Simple Twitter
item.description: Source Code at Github This is my first collaborative project. I worked with 2 teammates in 2 weeks implementing Agile Approach for developing a MVP (Minimum Viable Product) responsive social website which the main idea and design are trying to clone basic feature of twitter. In this experience, I learned: How to deal with conflicting code How to create branch to develop features then pull request on github asking review and merge to main project Review teammates’ code and give feedback My main assignments include: Features and front-end pages of register, login, logout All pages and functions of back management stage such as view all users and administrator status, delete specific tweets, etc.
